data.text:
Viewers, be warned: Theres a sickness loose in Hollywood these days, and its name is Victor Salva…

When JEEPERS CREEPERS opened in theaters in the late summer of 2001, it was a breath of fresh air for many Horror fans. Slick and smart, it took that old cliché of the genre—that people in Horror movies do stupid things, thus they die—and inverted it, to great effect. The kids menaced by the monster in this film do the SMART things. They seek help. They go to the police. And everybody STILL dies. THAT is scary. And speaking of scary—the creature doing the menacing, dubbed “the Creeper,” possesses the traits of numerous mythological monsters, but it is essentially a vampire. It consumes—eats—the particular parts of people it needs to sustain its existence. In particular, it’s after EYES this go-round.

After seeing and enjoying the movie (and its sequel), unfortunately, I found out that writer/director Victor Salva is a monster of sorts in his own right. A convicted child molester who served time in prison for abusing a young actor in one of his earlier films, Salva is the obese, creepy personification of perviness everyone envisions when they hear the word “pedophile.” Is it okay to enjoy the film, knowing what we do about Salva? I really loved that movie, but…
